business.headline: Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

Which are the best sectors to invest on Dalal Street right now? Check best picksFrom FMCG to NBFCs, railways, autos and even shipbuilders, analysts see opportunities across a range of sectors as Dalal Street faces volatility.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after opening lower amid F&O expiry, US visa curbsAt 9:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 95.55 points at 81,811.18, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 25.65 points to 25,082.55. Broader market indices also traded in the green, though overall sentiment on Dalal Street remained mixed.

Atlanta Electricals IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for Atlanta Electricals IPO can check their allotment status through either the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited.

Government imposes import curbs on plain silver jewellery till March 2026The restrictions have been introduced in the wake of an import of plain silver jewellery from under preferential duty exemptions rising steeply during April-June 2024-25 to April-June 2025-26.
Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

entertainment.headline: BB19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Salman schools Amaal, Gauahar urges Awez to raise voice This Weekend Ka Vaar of 'Bigg Boss 19' featured Tanya Mittal's birthday celebrations with heated confrontations, sharp remarks, and emotional breakdowns. Salman Khan schooled Amaal and Baseer for their gameplay, with Gauahar Khan urging Awez to raise his voice.

Please get some work: Did Salman Khan take a dig at Abhinav Kashyap? Salman Khan subtly addressed criticism against him after 'Dabangg' director Abhinav Kashyap made negative comments about him in a recent podcast. During a recent 'Bigg Boss 19' episode, Salman urged people to get a job and stop spreading negativity.

Prabhas' The RajaSaab trailer release date and time, all you need to know Pan-India superstar Prabhas fans are excited about his next release, The RajaSaab. The film opens in January 2026 and the buzz is already building, with the trailer all set to be launched.

Ranbir Kapoor gets sweet birthday wishes with throwback pics from Riddhima, Neetu Ranbir Kapoor turned 43 and got sweet birthday wishes from his sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni and mother Neetu Kapoor, who shared old family photos and messages.

Ranbir Kapoor back in Mumbai with Alia Bhatt, paps shower birthday wishes at airport Actor Ranbir Kapoor was seen with wife Alia Bhatt at the airport on his birthday. He acknowledged warm wishes from the paparazzi, who were stationed at the Mumbai airport on Sunday.

Vijay Karur rally stampede: Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth, celebs extend condolences The Karur rally tragedy has deeply saddened Tamil Nadu, with the film fraternity expressing shock and grief over the loss of 39 lives, including children, due to overcrowding and poor arrangements. Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan, and other celebs mourned the loss of lives.

Selena Gomez-Benny Blanco are married, singer shares dreamy photos Singer-actor Selena Gomez has married her longtime boyfriend and record producer Benny Blanco in an intimate wedding ceremony in Santa Barbara, California. She shared stunning pictures from the private celebration held on September 27, 2025.

Ahaan Panday in Sanjay Leela Bhansali film? Actor visits filmmaker, sparks buzz Bollywood's rising star Ahaan Panday was seen at Sanjay Leela Bhansali's office on Saturday, sparking widespread speculation about a potential collaboration between the two. Fans are eagerly awaiting an official announcement as excitement builds over this possible new project.

Varalaxmi Sarathkumar's directorial debut Saraswathi to star Priyamani, Prakash Raj Varalaxmi Sarathkumar is making her directorial debut with 'Saraswathi', produced under the new banner Dosa Diaries launched with her sister Pooja. The actor shared the announcement post on Saturday.

Ajith Kumar talks about dream F1 film collaboration and his racing passion Tamil superstar Ajith Kumar hinted at the possibility of making a Formula One film, blending his passion for racing with cinema. In an interview with India Today, he also expressed hope for an Indian driver to become a Formula One World Champion in his lifetime.

Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco's wedding: Date, guest list, what we know so far Set against the scenic backdrop of Santa Barbara, Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco are set for a secret, celebrity-filled wedding that promises to be intimate, unforgettable, and all that one can talk about. Here's all we know about D-Day so far.

Bigg Boss 19: Amaal Mallik is scolded by Salman Khan and Gauahar; watch promo In the upcoming 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar, Salman Khan scolded Amaal Mallik for his abusive behaviour and urged him to focus on his talent. Former winner Gauahar Khan also entered the house to give Amaal and Awez Darbar a reality check.

PVR's Aamer Bijli on bringing Shin-Chan to India, nostalgia, and anime obsession PVR Inox Pictures is bringing the beloved anime 'Shin-Chan' to Indian cinemas with 'Kasukabe Dancers'. The film's extensive localisation and nostalgic appeal aim to capture audiences across tier 2 and 3 cities, signalling growing anime popularity in India.

Shraddha Kapoor announces Choti Stree, animated spin-off from horror-comedy saga Shraddha Kapoor announced 'Choti Stree', an animated film from Maddock's horror-comedy universe that will explore the backstory of her iconic character. Producer Dinesh Vijan shared it will connect directly to 'Stree 3', releasing six months before the live-action sequel.

Jr NTR's Devara 2 announced on first film's anniversary On the first anniversary of 'Devara', the makers have confirmed the much-awaited sequel, 'Devara 2', thrilling fans across the nation. The original film's gripping storyline and Jr NTR's powerful dual roles have set high expectations for the upcoming action-packed continuation.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 34: Farrhana wins captaincy, Gaurav fumes over unfair decision In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', Farrhana Bhatt defeated Gaurav Khanna to become the new captain of the house. The loss didn't sit well with Gaurav, who lashed out at the opposition team, demanding fair play and transparency in the game.

Lokah 2 first look: Tovino Thomas takes superhero saga ahead, Dulquer Salmaan joins The Lokah universe is set to expand with the official announcement of 'Lokah Chapter 2', featuring Tovino Thomas and Dulquer Salmaan in a darker, thrilling sequel. Following the massive success of 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra', fans can expect an ambitious continuation of India's biggest Malayalam superhero saga.

Exclusive: Namashi Chakraborty feels Bollywood needs talent, not surnames Actor Namashi Chakraborty, who recently featured in director Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files', shared his views on opportunities for young talent, in an interview with IndiaToday.in. He also spoke about his actor father Mithun Chakraborty, films based on real events and more.

Nani's The Paradise: Mohan Babu is fierce in first look as Shikanja Maalik Mohan Babu is making a powerful comeback as the menacing villain Shikanja Maalik in Nani's upcoming multi-language film 'The Paradise'. The film, directed by Srikanth Odela, is set for a global release in March 2026.

general news.headline: Mithun Manhas, ex-Delhi cricketer, elected as new BCCI presidentMithun Manhas, ex-Delhi cricketer, elected as new BCCI president

Need to fix India, stop actions harming US interests: Trump aide's new threatTaking a potshot at India and Brazil, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that these countries need to do more to open their markets and stop taking actions that harm US interests.

Pak digs deep for Trump's favour, flaunts rare earths at White House meetThe photo came after a closed-door meeting at the Oval Office and weeks after a US metals company signed a $500 million investment deal with Pakistan.

The 260-year-old Durga that refused to move for immersion in Shiva's KashiImmersion of idols on Vijayadashami caps Durga Puja celebrations every year. However, in Varanasi's Madanpura, it's the same clay idol that has been being worshipped for almost 260 years now. Legend has it that in 1767, the Durga idol at Bengali Tola refused to move when people tried to take it out for immersion.

TikTok and the Death of Borderless TechThe TikTok saga signals the end of borderless tech. Platforms, AI, and supply chains now align with national priorities, marking a shift from supra-national to geo-national technology governance worldwide.

Asia Cup final: Did Suryakumar mock Pakistan one game too early?India vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: Suryakumar Yadav's blunt words may sound confident, but against Pakistan they can do more harm than good. In a rivalry where every comment becomes fuel, the only answer that matters will come from his bat, not from what he says before the first ball is bowled.

Hotel-hopping, fake PMO link: How molestation-accused Delhi baba evaded copsAccording to Delhi Police sources, the molestation-accused spiritual leader changed locations more than 15 times in an effort to avoid arrest. He strategically checked into hotels near prominent religious sites, knowing these areas attract less scrutiny and would allow him to blend in.

He tried to get me...: Elon Musk lashes out over Epstein Files mentionExplaining his side of the story, Elon Musk claimed that he refused Epstein's invitation to the private island and added, "Yet they name me even before Prince Andrew, who did visit."

Can Pakistan ride on law of averages to ruffle high-flying India?Asia Cup Final, IND vs PAK: Pakistan have lost seven matches on the trot against India, and will look to end their losing streak when they play in the grand finale on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

India vs Pakistan final: Asia Cup ready for coronation without handshakesIndia vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: Forty-one years after the inaugural Asia Cup, India and Pakistan face off in the final for the first time. Although India won their two earlier encounters comfortably, the cricket has been overshadowed by snubs, heated exchanges, and provocative gestures. This Asia Cup looks set to crown a champion without any handshakes between the finalists.

Case against Vijay's top aides after stampede at TVK rally leaves 39 deadTragedy struck Vijay's election campaign in Karur as a massive crowd crush claimed 39 lives and left dozens battling for survival. The Tamil Nadu rally, meant to showcase political strength, turned into the state's deadliest stampede in decades.
Shashi Tharoor has little sympathy for idli critics. His reply to X user goes viralShashi Tharoor used all poetic words when replying to an X user who said idli tastes like 'steamed regret.'

David Beckham, butter chicken and beyond: The Saransh Goila story on 'Anything But'He grew up vegetarian, fell in love over vegan rajma chawal, and turned butter chicken into a global phenomenon — this is the story of Saransh Goila on 'Anything But', where we talk about everything but their work.

Accenture lays off 11,000 employees, warns more job cuts are coming due to AIAccenture cuts over 11,000 jobs in three months amid a major AI-focused restructuring. The move signals a shift towards automation but raises concerns about the future of human expertise.

Security stepped up at Vijay's Chennai home after deadly Karur stampedeKarur District Police have filed FIRs against Anand, TVK's general secretary and second-in-command, and joint general secretary Nirmal Kumar following the Karur rally stampede that killed 39 people.

One nation openly declares terror as state policy: S Jaishankar tears into Pak at UN At the UN, India's S Jaishankar called Pakistan an "epicentre of global terrorism," cited the Pahalgam attack, and urged global action to choke terror financing, condemn state-backed terror, and uphold shared security.

3 killed in North Carolina after gunman opens fire at restaurant from boat: CopsA gunman opened fire at a popular restaurant from a boat in North Carolina's Southport. According to police, seven people were shot, of whom 3 died on the spot.

No fireworks, flares: Dubai Police issues strict security measures for Asia Cup final The Asia Cup 2025 final between India and Pakistan will be held under strict security protocols in Dubai. Authorities aim to ensure safety amid recent regional tensions and high fan expectations.

Arundhati Reddy recalls freak injury in England warm-up clash: Scared to even get up Women's World Cup, INDW vs NZW: Arundhati Reddy overcame a scary leg injury sustained against England, returning to take two crucial wickets against New Zealand with figures of 9-0-42-2.

Dinesh Karthik, Mithali Raj in star-studded commentary panel The ICC has unveiled a star-studded, female-led commentary panel for the 2025 Women's World Cup, combining legendary players, former international stars, and seasoned broadcasters to deliver expert and engaging coverage.

IND vs PAK: After 'no rivalry' claim, pressure on Suryakumar to deliver in final India captain Suryakumar Yadav will have a huge task at hand to live up to his words in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan, after dismissing the rivalry between the two teams. His poor form will only add to the pressure as he sets out to win his first major T20I crown as a skipper.

Samson can topple Dhoni and Pant in Asia Cup final despite limited chances Sanju Samson could make T20I history in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Despite limited chances, the wicketkeeper-batter is closing in on records set by MS Dhoni and Rishabh Pant.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
